item.title: Analyzing abnormally long win streaks in online chess
item.description: I’ve conducted a simple analysis using Elo win probability estimations and Monte-Carlo simulation to estimate the likelihood of Hikaru Nakamura achieving long winning streaks, as recently highlighted by Vladimir Kramnik. My findings suggest these streaks are not statistically anomalous and indicative of cheating. See Monte-Carlo simulation tables and conclusion below. This post does not aim to determine whether Hikaru Nakamura or other players have engaged in any form cheating. Instead, my goal is to critically examine historical data from Chess.
